speaker: LEONATO
text: I learn in this letter that Don

speaker: LEONATO
text: Pedro of Aragon comes this night to Messina.

speaker: MESSENGER
text: He is very near by this. He was not three

speaker: MESSENGER
text: leagues off when I left him.

speaker: LEONATO
text: How many gentlemen have you lost in this

speaker: LEONATO
text: action?

speaker: MESSENGER
text: But few of any sort, and none of name.

speaker: LEONATO
text: A victory is twice itself when the achiever

speaker: LEONATO
text: brings home full numbers. I find here that Don

speaker: LEONATO
text: Pedro hath bestowed much honor on a young

speaker: LEONATO
text: Florentine called Claudio.

speaker: MESSENGER
text: Much deserved on his part, and equally

speaker: MESSENGER
text: remembered by Don Pedro. He hath borne himself

speaker: MESSENGER
text: beyond the promise of his age, doing in the figure

speaker: MESSENGER
text: of a lamb the feats of a lion. He hath indeed better

speaker: MESSENGER
text: bettered expectation than you must expect of me to

speaker: MESSENGER
text: tell you how.

speaker: LEONATO
text: He hath an uncle here in Messina will be

speaker: LEONATO
text: very much glad of it.

speaker: MESSENGER
text: I have already delivered him letters, and

speaker: MESSENGER
text: there appears much joy in him, even so much that

speaker: MESSENGER
text: joy could not show itself modest enough without a

speaker: MESSENGER
text: badge of bitterness.

speaker: LEONATO
text: Did he break out into tears?

speaker: MESSENGER
text: In great measure.

speaker: LEONATO
text: A kind overflow of kindness. There are no

speaker: LEONATO
text: faces truer than those that are so washed. How

speaker: LEONATO
text: much better is it to weep at joy than to joy at

speaker: LEONATO
text: weeping!

speaker: BEATRICE
text: I pray you, is Signior Mountanto returned

speaker: BEATRICE
text: from the wars or no?

speaker: MESSENGER
text: I know none of that name, lady. There

speaker: MESSENGER
text: was none such in the army of any sort.

speaker: LEONATO
text: What is he that you ask for, niece?

speaker: HERO
text: My cousin means Signior Benedick of Padua.

speaker: MESSENGER
text: O, he’s returned, and as pleasant as ever

speaker: MESSENGER
text: he was.

speaker: BEATRICE
text: He set up his bills here in Messina and

speaker: BEATRICE
text: challenged Cupid at the flight, and my uncle’s Fool,

speaker: BEATRICE
text: reading the challenge, subscribed for Cupid and

speaker: BEATRICE
text: challenged him at the bird-bolt. I pray you, how

speaker: BEATRICE
text: many hath he killed and eaten in these wars? But

speaker: BEATRICE
text: how many hath he killed? For indeed I promised to

speaker: BEATRICE
text: eat all of his killing.

speaker: LEONATO
text: Faith, niece, you tax Signior Benedick too

speaker: LEONATO
text: much, but he’ll be meet with you, I doubt it not.

speaker: MESSENGER
text: He hath done good service, lady, in these

speaker: MESSENGER
text: wars.

speaker: BEATRICE
text: You had musty victual, and he hath holp to

speaker: BEATRICE
text: eat it. He is a very valiant trencherman; he hath an

speaker: BEATRICE
text: excellent stomach.

speaker: MESSENGER
text: And a good soldier too, lady.

speaker: BEATRICE
text: And a good soldier to a lady, but what is he

speaker: BEATRICE
text: to a lord?

speaker: MESSENGER
text: A lord to a lord, a man to a man, stuffed

speaker: MESSENGER
text: with all honorable virtues.

speaker: BEATRICE
text: It is so indeed. He is no less than a stuffed

speaker: BEATRICE
text: man, but for the stuffing—well, we are all mortal.

speaker: LEONATO
text: You must not, sir, mistake my niece. There is

speaker: LEONATO
text: a kind of merry war betwixt Signior Benedick and

speaker: LEONATO
text: her. They never meet but there’s a skirmish of wit

speaker: LEONATO
text: between them.

speaker: BEATRICE
text: Alas, he gets nothing by that. In our last

speaker: BEATRICE
text: conflict, four of his five wits went halting off, and

speaker: BEATRICE
text: now is the whole man governed with one, so that if

speaker: BEATRICE
text: he have wit enough to keep himself warm, let him

speaker: BEATRICE
text: bear it for a difference between himself and his

speaker: BEATRICE
text: horse, for it is all the wealth that he hath left to

speaker: BEATRICE
text: be known a reasonable creature. Who is his companion

speaker: BEATRICE
text: now? He hath every month a new sworn

speaker: BEATRICE
text: brother.

speaker: MESSENGER
text: Is ’t possible?

speaker: BEATRICE
text: Very easily possible. He wears his faith but

speaker: BEATRICE
text: as the fashion of his hat; it ever changes with the

speaker: BEATRICE
text: next block.

speaker: MESSENGER
text: I see, lady, the gentleman is not in your

speaker: MESSENGER
text: books.

speaker: BEATRICE
text: No. An he were, I would burn my study. But

speaker: BEATRICE
text: I pray you, who is his companion? Is there no

speaker: BEATRICE
text: young squarer now that will make a voyage with

speaker: BEATRICE
text: him to the devil?

speaker: MESSENGER
text: He is most in the company of the right

speaker: MESSENGER
text: noble Claudio.

speaker: BEATRICE
text: O Lord, he will hang upon him like a

speaker: BEATRICE
text: disease! He is sooner caught than the pestilence,

speaker: BEATRICE
text: and the taker runs presently mad. God help the

speaker: BEATRICE
text: noble Claudio! If he have caught the Benedick, it

speaker: BEATRICE
text: will cost him a thousand pound ere he be cured.

speaker: MESSENGER
text: I will hold friends with you, lady.

speaker: BEATRICE
text: Do, good friend.

speaker: LEONATO
text: You will never run mad, niece.

speaker: BEATRICE
text: No, not till a hot January.

speaker: MESSENGER
text: Don Pedro is approached.

speaker: PRINCE
text: Good Signior Leonato, are you come to meet

speaker: PRINCE
text: your trouble? The fashion of the world is to avoid

speaker: PRINCE
text: cost, and you encounter it.

speaker: LEONATO
text: Never came trouble to my house in the

speaker: LEONATO
text: likeness of your Grace, for trouble being gone,

speaker: LEONATO
text: comfort should remain, but when you depart from

speaker: LEONATO
text: me, sorrow abides and happiness takes his leave.

speaker: PRINCE
text: You embrace your charge too willingly.

speaker: PRINCE
text: I think this is your daughter.

speaker: LEONATO
text: Her mother hath many times told me so.

speaker: BENEDICK
text: Were you in doubt, sir, that you asked her?

speaker: LEONATO
text: Signior Benedick, no, for then were you a

speaker: LEONATO
text: child.

speaker: PRINCE
text: You have it full, Benedick. We may guess by

speaker: PRINCE
text: this what you are, being a man. Truly the lady

speaker: PRINCE
text: fathers herself.—Be happy, lady, for you are like

speaker: PRINCE
text: an honorable father.

speaker: BENEDICK
text: If Signior Leonato be her father, she would

speaker: BENEDICK
text: not have his head on her shoulders for all Messina,

speaker: BENEDICK
text: as like him as she is.

speaker: BEATRICE
text: I wonder that you will still be talking, Signior

speaker: BEATRICE
text: Benedick, nobody marks you.

speaker: BENEDICK
text: What, my dear Lady Disdain! Are you yet

speaker: BENEDICK
text: living?

speaker: BEATRICE
text: Is it possible disdain should die while she

speaker: BEATRICE
text: hath such meet food to feed it as Signior Benedick?

speaker: BEATRICE
text: Courtesy itself must convert to disdain if you come

speaker: BEATRICE
text: in her presence.

speaker: BENEDICK
text: Then is courtesy a turncoat. But it is certain

speaker: BENEDICK
text: I am loved of all ladies, only you excepted; and

speaker: BENEDICK
text: I would I could find in my heart that I had not a

speaker: BENEDICK
text: hard heart, for truly I love none.

speaker: BEATRICE
text: A dear happiness to women. They would

speaker: BEATRICE
text: else have been troubled with a pernicious suitor. I

speaker: BEATRICE
text: thank God and my cold blood I am of your humor

speaker: BEATRICE
text: for that. I had rather hear my dog bark at a crow

speaker: BEATRICE
text: than a man swear he loves me.

speaker: BENEDICK
text: God keep your Ladyship still in that mind,

speaker: BENEDICK
text: so some gentleman or other shall ’scape a predestinate

speaker: BENEDICK
text: scratched face.

speaker: BEATRICE
text: Scratching could not make it worse an

speaker: BEATRICE
text: ’twere such a face as yours were.

speaker: BENEDICK
text: Well, you are a rare parrot-teacher.

speaker: BEATRICE
text: A bird of my tongue is better than a beast of

speaker: BEATRICE
text: yours.

speaker: BENEDICK
text: I would my horse had the speed of your

speaker: BENEDICK
text: tongue and so good a continuer, but keep your

speaker: BENEDICK
text: way, i’ God’s name, I have done.

speaker: BEATRICE
text: You always end with a jade’s trick. I know

speaker: BEATRICE
text: you of old.

speaker: PRINCE
text: That is the sum of all, Leonato.—Signior

speaker: PRINCE
text: Claudio and Signior Benedick, my dear friend

speaker: PRINCE
text: Leonato hath invited you all. I tell him we shall stay

speaker: PRINCE
text: here at the least a month, and he heartily prays

speaker: PRINCE
text: some occasion may detain us longer. I dare swear

speaker: PRINCE
text: he is no hypocrite, but prays from his heart.

speaker: LEONATO
text: If you swear, my lord, you shall not be

speaker: LEONATO
text:
forsworn.
                 
                To
                 
                Don
                 
                John
                .
               Let me bid you welcome,

speaker: LEONATO
text: my lord, being reconciled to the Prince your brother,

speaker: LEONATO
text: I owe you all duty.

speaker:
DON
               
              JOHN
text: I thank you. I am not of many words, but I

speaker:
DON
               
              JOHN
text: thank you.

speaker: LEONATO
text: Please it your Grace lead on?

speaker: PRINCE
text: Your hand, Leonato. We will go together.

speaker: CLAUDIO
text: Benedick, didst thou note the daughter of

speaker: CLAUDIO
text: Signior Leonato?

speaker: BENEDICK
text: I noted her not, but I looked on her.

speaker: CLAUDIO
text: Is she not a modest young lady?

speaker: BENEDICK
text: Do you question me as an honest man

speaker: BENEDICK
text: should do, for my simple true judgment? Or would

speaker: BENEDICK
text: you have me speak after my custom, as being a

speaker: BENEDICK
text: professed tyrant to their sex?

speaker: CLAUDIO
text: No, I pray thee, speak in sober judgment.

speaker: BENEDICK
text: Why, i’ faith, methinks she’s too low for a

speaker: BENEDICK
text: high praise, too brown for a fair praise, and too

speaker: BENEDICK
text: little for a great praise. Only this commendation I

speaker: BENEDICK
text: can afford her, that were she other than she is, she

speaker: BENEDICK
text: were unhandsome, and being no other but as she is,

speaker: BENEDICK
text: I do not like her.

speaker: CLAUDIO
text: Thou thinkest I am in sport. I pray thee tell

speaker: CLAUDIO
text: me truly how thou lik’st her.

speaker: BENEDICK
text: Would you buy her that you enquire after

speaker: BENEDICK
text: her?

speaker: CLAUDIO
text: Can the world buy such a jewel?

speaker: BENEDICK
text: Yea, and a case to put it into. But speak you

speaker: BENEDICK
text: this with a sad brow? Or do you play the flouting

speaker: BENEDICK
text: jack, to tell us Cupid is a good hare-finder and

speaker: BENEDICK
text: Vulcan a rare carpenter? Come, in what key shall a

speaker: BENEDICK
text: man take you to go in the song?

speaker: CLAUDIO
text: In mine eye she is the sweetest lady that ever

speaker: CLAUDIO
text: I looked on.

speaker: BENEDICK
text: I can see yet without spectacles, and I see

speaker: BENEDICK
text: no such matter. There’s her cousin, an she were not

speaker: BENEDICK
text: possessed with a fury, exceeds her as much in

speaker: BENEDICK
text: beauty as the first of May doth the last of December.

speaker: BENEDICK
text: But I hope you have no intent to turn husband, have

speaker: BENEDICK
text: you?

speaker: CLAUDIO
text: I would scarce trust myself, though I had

speaker: CLAUDIO
text: sworn the contrary, if Hero would be my wife.

speaker: BENEDICK
text: Is ’t come to this? In faith, hath not the

speaker: BENEDICK
text: world one man but he will wear his cap with

speaker: BENEDICK
text: suspicion? Shall I never see a bachelor of threescore

speaker: BENEDICK
text: again? Go to, i’ faith, an thou wilt needs thrust

speaker: BENEDICK
text: thy neck into a yoke, wear the print of it, and sigh

speaker: BENEDICK
text: away Sundays. Look, Don Pedro is returned to seek

speaker: BENEDICK
text: you.

speaker: PRINCE
text: What secret hath held you here that you followed

speaker: PRINCE
text: not to Leonato’s?

speaker: BENEDICK
text: I would your Grace would constrain me to

speaker: BENEDICK
text: tell.

speaker: PRINCE
text: I charge thee on thy allegiance.

speaker: BENEDICK
text: You hear, Count Claudio, I can be secret as

speaker: BENEDICK
text: a dumb man, I would have you think so, but on my

speaker: BENEDICK
text: allegiance—mark you this, on my allegiance—he

speaker: BENEDICK
text: is in love. With who? Now, that is your Grace’s part.

speaker: BENEDICK
text: Mark how short his answer is: with Hero, Leonato’s

speaker: BENEDICK
text: short daughter.

speaker: CLAUDIO
text: If this were so, so were it uttered.

speaker: BENEDICK
text: Like the old tale, my lord: “It is not so, nor

speaker: BENEDICK
text: ’twas not so, but, indeed, God forbid it should be

speaker: BENEDICK
text: so.”

speaker: CLAUDIO
text: If my passion change not shortly, God forbid

speaker: CLAUDIO
text: it should be otherwise.

speaker: PRINCE
text: Amen, if you love her, for the lady is very well

speaker: PRINCE
text: worthy.

speaker: CLAUDIO
text: You speak this to fetch me in, my lord.

speaker: PRINCE
text: By my troth, I speak my thought.

speaker: CLAUDIO
text: And in faith, my lord, I spoke mine.

speaker: BENEDICK
text: And by my two faiths and troths, my lord, I

speaker: BENEDICK
text: spoke mine.

speaker: CLAUDIO
text: That I love her, I feel.

speaker: PRINCE
text: That she is worthy, I know.

speaker: BENEDICK
text: That I neither feel how she should be loved

speaker: BENEDICK
text: nor know how she should be worthy is the opinion

speaker: BENEDICK
text: that fire cannot melt out of me. I will die in it at the

speaker: BENEDICK
text: stake.

speaker: PRINCE
text: Thou wast ever an obstinate heretic in the

speaker: PRINCE
text: despite of beauty.

speaker: CLAUDIO
text: And never could maintain his part but in the

speaker: CLAUDIO
text: force of his will.

speaker: BENEDICK
text: That a woman conceived me, I thank her;

speaker: BENEDICK
text: that she brought me up, I likewise give her most

speaker: BENEDICK
text: humble thanks. But that I will have a recheat

speaker: BENEDICK
text: winded in my forehead or hang my bugle in an

speaker: BENEDICK
text: invisible baldrick, all women shall pardon me.

speaker: BENEDICK
text: Because I will not do them the wrong to mistrust

speaker: BENEDICK
text: any, I will do myself the right to trust none. And the

speaker: BENEDICK
text: fine is, for the which I may go the finer, I will live a

speaker: BENEDICK
text: bachelor.

speaker: PRINCE
text: I shall see thee, ere I die, look pale with love.

speaker: BENEDICK
text: With anger, with sickness, or with hunger,

speaker: BENEDICK
text: my lord, not with love. Prove that ever I lose more

speaker: BENEDICK
text: blood with love than I will get again with drinking,

speaker: BENEDICK
text: pick out mine eyes with a ballad-maker’s pen and

speaker: BENEDICK
text: hang me up at the door of a brothel house for the

speaker: BENEDICK
text: sign of blind Cupid.

speaker: PRINCE
text: Well, if ever thou dost fall from this faith, thou

speaker: PRINCE
text: wilt prove a notable argument.

speaker: BENEDICK
text: If I do, hang me in a bottle like a cat and

speaker: BENEDICK
text: shoot at me, and he that hits me, let him be clapped

speaker: BENEDICK
text: on the shoulder and called Adam.

speaker: PRINCE
text: Well, as time shall try.

speaker: PRINCE
text: In time the savage bull doth bear the yoke.

speaker: BENEDICK
text: The savage bull may, but if ever the sensible

speaker: BENEDICK
text: Benedick bear it, pluck off the bull’s horns and set

speaker: BENEDICK
text: them in my forehead, and let me be vilely painted,

speaker: BENEDICK
text: and in such great letters as they write “Here is good

speaker: BENEDICK
text: horse to hire” let them signify under my sign “Here

speaker: BENEDICK
text: you may see Benedick the married man.”

speaker: CLAUDIO
text: If this should ever happen, thou wouldst be

speaker: CLAUDIO
text: horn-mad.

speaker: PRINCE
text: Nay, if Cupid have not spent all his quiver in

speaker: PRINCE
text: Venice, thou wilt quake for this shortly.

speaker: BENEDICK
text: I look for an earthquake too, then.

speaker: PRINCE
text: Well, you will temporize with the hours. In the

speaker: PRINCE
text: meantime, good Signior Benedick, repair to Leonato’s.

speaker: PRINCE
text: Commend me to him, and tell him I will not

speaker: PRINCE
text: fail him at supper, for indeed he hath made great

speaker: PRINCE
text: preparation.

speaker: BENEDICK
text: I have almost matter enough in me for such

speaker: BENEDICK
text: an embassage, and so I commit you—

speaker: CLAUDIO
text: To the tuition of God. From my house, if I had

speaker: CLAUDIO
text: it—

speaker: PRINCE
text: The sixth of July. Your loving friend,

speaker: PRINCE
text: Benedick.

speaker: BENEDICK
text: Nay, mock not, mock not. The body of your

speaker: BENEDICK
text: discourse is sometimes guarded with fragments,

speaker: BENEDICK
text: and the guards are but slightly basted on neither.

speaker: BENEDICK
text: Ere you flout old ends any further, examine your

speaker: BENEDICK
text: conscience. And so I leave you.

              ,

All

That

How

That

I

What
